pullRequest.title: Feature: Add ability for game client to download map listing from maps server
pullRequest.bodyText:
Refactor: move 'fetch maps' functionality from ClientContext to a dedicated class
'MapListingFetcher'
Add map server URI to servers listing
Adds a new map server URI override mechanism with a 'dev-overrides.properties' file.
Uncommenting properties in that file will have them take effect and override config.
This is a simpler way to inject overrides compared to using ClientSettings. We have
such a mechanism for lobby server and likely that will be migrated as it's simpler.
Of note, the dev-overrides.properties file is not required and we do not expect
it to be present when the game is distributed.
Adds an HTTP client to fetch map listing from the maps server
Adds a 'beta' switch to use the maps server for map listing download. If the switch
is set then we use the maps server. In this case we'll use the new http client
to download the map listing from the maps server.
Fixes download map listing logic where the download maps window is not rendered
if the map download list. In such cases, the map download button would appear
to do nothing to the user, so better to show a download map window with
nothing available, at least it is something.


Testing

verified when the new maps-server-beta flag is unchecked (default) then we get existing behavior
verified that commenting in or out the values from the dev-overrides.properties file will use or ignore values respectively
with a local maps server (not yet checked in), was able to do a stubbed download map listing.


Screens Shots

Additional Notes to Reviewer

Release Note

nodes.bodyText: This method is moved to a dedicated class.

The 'all args constructor' in this class is replaced by annotation.
The construction mechanism and overall this class was simplified and refactored.
There is a utility constructor that omits the 'image' parameter. That was removed by simplifying updating clients to use the all arg constructor, which in turn use the constructor defined by the lombok parameter. We then add a conversion constructor to go from a 'MapFileDownloadListing' to a 'DownloadListing'.
Of note, we introduce a new class 'MapFileDownloadListing' so that we can transmit pure strings (no enums and no Version object) over network. This gives us more flexibility for compatibility, hence the need for a conversion constructor.

These 'from' methods are used by conversion constructor. Of note we create a 'default' case to map to an enum value to give us flexibiity in case we change this going in the forward and then old clients do not have the new values. In this case the new clients will use the default value.
All clients that used this constructor now use the all-args constructor directly.
this constructor is replaced by lombok
Getters are replaced by lombok
This is the new conversion constructor, the main update to this class.

This is a bit of a fix. If we get an empty list and no other error, then clicking the 'download maps' button does nothing. Removing this filter at least has the button doing something, albeit we show an empty download maps window, but at least that is something.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -217,7 +217,6 @@ private void initialize(final Collection<String> mapNames) {
 
       Interruptibles.awaitResult(SingletonManager::getMapDownloadListInBackground)
           .result
-          .filter(not(Collection::isEmpty))

nodes.bodyText: This 'if' statement is new and is logic to grab the map download listing from server (behind beta flag). The 'else' block is existing logic that is executed if the beta flag is not turned on (default)

This class is all new. Instead of creating client setting override settings that can get very tricky and involves radio buttons, instead we have a props file where we add values, comment them out, and then can uncomment them to activate them. I was looking at replicating the lobby server override setting and it would have been complex to replicate that for another server.
Though, having a client setting config to allow all users switch between production and prerelease is still useful, so we want to be sure we keep in mind non-dev's that are testing our software and that they are given the proper override controls. For now and for maps server this seemed like the most easy & direct way to get overrides.

beforeCommit.message:
Add ability for game client to download map listing from maps server

- Refactor: move 'fetch maps' functionality from ClientContext to a dedicated class
  'MapListingFetcher'
- Add map server URI to servers listing
- Adds a new map server URI override mechanism with a 'dev-overrides.properties' file.
  Uncommenting properties in that file will have them take effect and override config.
  This is a simpler way to inject overrides compared to using ClientSettings. We have
  such a mechanism for lobby server and likely that will be migrated as it's simpler.
  Of note, the dev-overrides.properties file is not required and we do not expect
  it to be present when the game is distributed.
- Adds an HTTP client to fetch map listing from the maps server
- Adds a 'beta' switch to use the maps server for map listing download. If the switch
  is set then we use the maps server. In this case we'll use the new http client
  to download the map listing from the maps server.
- Fixes download map listing logic where the download maps window is not rendered
  if the map download list. In such cases, the map download button would appear
  to do nothing to the user, so better to show a download map window with
  nothing available, at least it is something.

nodes.bodyText: Would you mind adding this information to the javadoc?

I wonder how well this out-of-date mechanism can be improved.
Maybe calculating the hash sum of the zip and double check with the server that caches the hash values?
So just to get this straight: The "regular user" will not see another entry in client settings, correct?
If you decide not to use java.nio here, this FileInputStream should be closed after this regardless

I personally think avoiding dashes in subdomains is better, so instead of prerelease-maps.triplea-game.org I'd like to go with prerelease.maps.triplea-game.org, so the production version can either be maps.triplea-game.org or prod.maps.triplea-game.org.
In either case I don't think the way we give out names to subdomains is really consistent at the moment, so ideally we'd agree on something rather sooner than later deprecating (but keeping in case we need backwards compatibility) the current subdomains
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,6 +2,7 @@ latest: 2.2.20790
 servers:
   - version: "2.0.20057"
     lobby_uri: https://prod2-lobby.triplea-game.org
+    maps_uri: https://prerelease-maps.triplea-game.org

commit.message: Reduce method visibility from package default to private.
Ensure file input stream is closed when reading dev overrride properties file.

nodes.bodyText:
No need to convert it to java.io.File first

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                "Failed to read override file: " + overrideFile.toFile().getAbsolutePath(),
          
          
            
                                "Failed to read override file: " + overrideFile.toAbsolutePath(),

AFAIK BufferedInputStream or BufferedReader which uses the former internally, is more efficient.
Other than that there shouldn't be a huge difference.
